list_definition.definition: (opposite unready) prepared; able to be used etc immediately or when needed; able to do (something) immediately or when necessary

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve packed our cases, so we’re ready to leave
Your coat has been cleaned and is ready (to be collected).
You’re too ready to find faults in other people
He always has a ready answer.
My head feels as if it’s ready to burst.

list_ex_of_english: We are now ready to establish a local formula for the pointwise dimension of invariant measures that are not necessarily ergodic.
Finally, we are ready to prove the following.
Citing previous cognitive work, she notes that shorter phrases require less processing and are more ready to be articulated before longer ones.
We are now ready to analyse the effect of the introduction of preferential trading.
We are now ready to prove our main theorem.
We do not know, however, whether these figures were readied in every case.
We are now ready to prove the following.
Moreover, mature trees ready for harvest may be grown for historical, socioeconomic, and geographical reasons, rather than due to the management effort.
